text:
hey everyone welcome to Pai's kitchen and if you're 
new to Pai's kitchen this is sort of like a sister

show to hot thai kitchen where i can share with 
you all the delicious things that are not a part

of thai cuisine and so the recipe i'm sharing 
with you today when i first made it i hadn't

planned for it to be on the show but when i was 
done with it i thought this is great i need to

share it with you guys it's one of those dishes 
that have very few ingredients very simple prep

but it is so so delicious so it's perfect for 
you know like a Wednesday night you're kind of

tired you don't want to wait two hours for 
dinner but you still want good food this is

it so it's a pasta dish with roasted eggplant 
and a garlicky tomatoey sauce also good and

because I am making it it's also going to be a 
little bit spicy but that's optional so let's

get started all right let's take a look at the 
ingredients I've got some dried chilies you can

also just use chili flakes it just happens to 
be what I have a ton of garlic finely chopped

and this is a garlicky sauce of your garlic 
lover yay some chopped tomatoes now this is

roma tomatoes and roma tomatoes are perfect 
for pasta sauce because it doesn't have a lot

of juice not a lot of water so it's flavorful 
and you don't have to cook it for so long to

evaporate all that liquid now this looks like a 
lot of tomatoes but one of the reasons I came up

with this dish was I wanted tomato sauce but I 
didn't want to wait to simmer it for like half

an hour however long it normally takes to make 
actual tomato sauce so this is sort of my hack

to make a quick tomato pasta okay I've got some 
linguine you can use whatever kind of pasta you

want one trick is choose pasta that's got a matte 
surface it creates a rough surface and it holds

on to sauce better eggplant now if you don't 
like eggplant you don't have to add eggplant

it won't really affect that as you can do zucchini 
whatever kind of vegetables you like roasted okay

as an option I love this dish vegetarian but if 
you want you can also add some Italian sausage

this is Italian sausage that I've taken out of 
the casing so it's great if you want something

a little stronger flavor you know something with 
extra protein finally some basil now I've got a

is a planned here and what I love about this I 
bought this at the grocery store and they were

selling these for $2.99 which is the same price as 
the back of Kutch basil so why wouldn't I get this

one the amount was about the same and this will 
last a long time it's fresher like this one I've

had for at least three weeks but it still looks 
good it's still fresh it's so much more worth

it I'm going to start by roasting the eggplant a 
little bit of olive oil and salt and pepper that's

it give this a quick toss just to mix everything 
together and the eggplant will really just soak

up all that oil so don't worry about like oh 
my oh that's all gone and then it just goes in

the oven you don't have to worry about it for the 
next 10 minutes 425 degree Fahrenheit by the way

so this is only if you are using the Italian 
sausage or any other kind of protein I'm going

to cook the sausage separately and I do that 
because the sausage is going to give off a lot

of fat and really strong flavor and I kind of 
like to keep my pasta flavor clean rather than

it tasting like Italian sausage all over break 
it into little chunks I don't want it to like

end up looking like ground meat rikes I want nice 
chewiness in them and that is it now we are ready

to put it all together yes so I'm using a wok to 
cook a pasta dish because I'm much preferred you

can stir to your heart's content and nothing is 
going to jump out on you so the way I timed this

dish is as soon as I'm ready to put everything 
together I drop my pasta just before I start the

sauce okay so then the pasta doesn't have to sit 
and wait for me okay so I've got a pot of water

back there make sure you salt your pasta water 
about one teaspoon of salt to a liter of water

okay so I always set the timer one minute less 
than what the package says to do because I want

the last minute of cooking to happen in the pan 
it'll help the pasta absorb the sauce better in

my wok here I'm going to just put the heat quite 
low and I've got some olive oil going in and all

of the garlic yes yes that's a lot of garlic 
that's why it's so good and also the chilies

and what I want to do at this point is for the 
garlic to slowly infuse itself into the olive

oil and for it to soften so it sort of becomes a 
part of the sauce you know so now the garlic is

nice and soft and I can really smell garlic in 
the air I'm going to crank the heat now and as

soon as I do that I add my tomatoes because what 
I want now is for the tomatoes to cook down for

the water to evaporate okay a good pinch of salt 
my pepper and just let it cook down this is why

I like a walk to you've got a large surface area 
water can evaporate really quickly while that's

going I'm going to bring over my eggplant and see 
I'll just show you quickly what the eggplant looks

like nice and brown along the edges so if you 
can if you have convection oven use convection

that happens a lot quicker okay so what you're 
looking for here is for the tomatoes to start

to loose their integrity once it starts to look 
mushy I'm going to add the eggplant right away

because I don't want it to become a complete mush 
I like that chunks of tomato give that a toss and

then I'm going to add my sausage if using again 
I've done this vegetarian and it was absolutely

delicious so don't feel like you have to add 
the sausage and I'm being careful not to add

any of the oil from the sausage and that's it 
I'm going to turn this off because now the next

thing to go in is my pasta in my pasta has just 
two more minutes on it see the timing works out

really well when your Wednesday night you want to 
maximize your time all right so I am going to put

the pasta directly into the pot I'm not going 
to drain it because I actually want to keep the

pasta water and then you don't need to wash a 
colander just about a half a cup of pasta water

and the pasta water has some starch that's left 
the pasta and it's going to help bind the pasta

and the sauce together - oh yes oh and that's 
another thing because you're going to add pasta

water which is salted you don't want to make the 
sauce too salty to begin with okay so I seasoned

it to make sure it's salty but it's on the mild 
side that looks fantastic and that's it how easy

is that very nice now yes I know I haven't put the 
basil in and there's a reason for that because I

find that basil turns black really quickly when 
it's hot so I learned this from a local Italian

restaurant actually they just put the basil on top 
at the end before they serve it so when it gets

to the table it's so nice and fresh and you as a 
diner can mix it all in so pretty that just makes

a fresh Oh spinach if you want to do eggplant put 
some spinach in there that'll be really pretty as

well and of course seeing as we are making 
a version of Italian food we're going to add

some parmesan note it down a Parmesan cheese nice 
shaving with a microplane very nice whoo all right

eggplant some Tomatoes some basil you've got 
to compose the perfect bite oh it hits all

the right spot I'll bend their pasta such a 
satisfying true tomato a super garlic in that

eggplant you know eggplant just becomes tender 
and juicy once you start chewing on them are so

perfect and it's got a kick that is a spicy 
pasta Oh so I hope you give this a try the

recipe will be on hot Thai Kitchen calm and when 
you make it send me a photo on Facebook Twitter

or Instagram and please subscribe to the show of 
you enjoy it so you never miss an awesome recipe

like this and I will see you next time for your 
next submission adventure when I first made it

I hadn't actually planned on it being on the 
ship planned for it to be planned on it being

a mission no I hadn't planned to put everything 
I hadn't planned on it to be able to be for the

honest place no I had my plan to be on the show 
I hadn't planned for it to be on the show okay
